website_summaries.verdict: This all-organic recipe will please any health nuts. And with 120 servings per bag, it's a steal.
pros: A&I's powder has no added sugars or sweeteners, unlike some other powders
Users rave about the earthy yet mild taste, and say it helps with chronic pain
cons: The ginger is heavy-handed for some

customer_reviews.title: and it was just as good as my homemade blend
customer_reviews.text: I usually make my own turmeric paste for golden lattes, but I bought several of these to give as gifts this winter. I was able to make myself a cup with my mom's bag, and it was just as good as my homemade blend. The spices are well proportioned, and I appreciate that the company knew to include the black pepper to make the significantly boost the bioavailability of the curcumin. I may buy it for myself soon!
customer_reviews.author: EllenKT

customer_reviews.title: Nice blend of spices.
customer_reviews.text: This blend of spices is so warming and delicious! I make it with coconut milk, coconut butter and a little honey. I also add a scoop of collagen. So nice to have a new hot drink without caffeine. I enjoy this after dinner.
customer_reviews.author: K. Hayes

customer_reviews.title: I like that it has no added sugar so I can ...
customer_reviews.text: It’s delicious! I like that it has no added sugar so I can control the sweetness I prefer. I haven’t tried making it according to the suggestion on the packet; Instead, I just heated up a cup of vanilla almond milk then added 1tsp of this golden milk powder, plus a drizzle of agave syrup (I like my latte sweet). The only thing is that you have to really whisk the powder into the hot almond milk until the clumps are gone.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Yummy yummy yummy!
customer_reviews.text: I was mixing my own. This is just as good of not better and much easier! My husband LOVES this stuff and drinks so much milk (whole, fresh, raw cows milk for us) now that we have it. It tastes like chi latte to us but my neighbor think it tastes like egg nog. Either way, its totally delicious and satisfying (not to mention all the health benefits which is why we bought it).
customer_reviews.author: Shelly D Filkins

customer_reviews.title: Omg tastes so good.
customer_reviews.text: Omg mix this with almond milk a little honey and a Avocado it tastes sooooo good I love it lol. Maybe to much I'll probably get a stomach ache making a few a day... ok i wont do it because I'm sure it'll be to much, but on taste alone its 5star. It'll stay 5 stars unless it does nothing at all for me then I'll give a 4star. Lol
customer_reviews.author: J&L

customer_reviews.title: Great Ingredients and Very Good in Curry
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE how the company uses 1) ceylon cinnamon (cassia and other varieties commonly sold in US are actually used as rat poison in other countries) 2) organic everything 3) black pepper with the turmeric as this enhances curcumin (the benefial component of turmeric) absorption. This spice mix is great in a pinch: Very good in curry. Just lentils and sweet potato, this, and you are all set. Of course, you can add other spices to enhance flavor or make more of a lunch curry than a breakfast curry but still works on its own. Also, nice to add to small snacks or sprinkle on things you find yourself eating when you get hungry.
customer_reviews.author: Robert P Rock

customer_reviews.title: I Golden Milk blend everyday for general health and joint issues
customer_reviews.text: I like the purity of the ingredients. It blends fine. I use a small battery operated whisk. I like to put it in my moring coffee but this one needs some sweetening IMO, as it does taste very "earthy." Not bad and inherent in its main ingredient of turmeric. I prefer another brand for my coffee so switched to using this one in my chaffles when I make them and love it for that use!
customer_reviews.author: Chrystalsea

customer_reviews.title: Good for cinnamon lovers!
customer_reviews.text: This is the second brand of golden milk that I’ve purchased, so I only have one comparison to go by! The flavor is good, but definitely very cinnamon-forward. I also find that I have to keep a spoon handy while drinking so that I can keep the powder mixed in. It ends up feeling grainy, and I’m left with a small puddle of powder at the bottom of my cup when I’m finished. Overall, not bad, but I do prefer a smoother mixture.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Five Star Beverage: truly the BEST Golden Milk EVER!
customer_reviews.text: I have compared many Golden Milk blends and brands, and I fell in LOVE with these ingredients. They are all organic and really good quality. The flavor is delicious, it is soft, it relaxes me, it helps me sleep well. I have recommended it a lot and people have LOVED it. I will definitely consume it for the rest of my life. This is a Woman-owned business and I always try to support them. Also, the new matte black packaging is awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Robert Lee

customer_reviews.title: Great golden milk mix!
customer_reviews.text: This is the first time I've ever tried golden milk and I'm hooked. I received this last night and made my first cup before bed. The taste is mild, blends well and delicious! I'm hoping to notice the health benefits soon. I usually take turmeric capsules to help for joint pain and its anti-inflammatory properties. Looking forward to incorporating this into my daily health regime. I like that this mix doesn't include any addictives or sugar.
customer_reviews.author: Bcb70

customer_reviews.title: Best ingredients, so delicious
customer_reviews.text: The only Golden Milk blend I will purchase. Really high end quality ingredients. I love that the cinnamon in this is the best of all cinnamons, which is "Ceylon". Do your research, Cassia cinnamon (cheaper and most used) can be harmful when consumed in larger quantities. Ceylon cinnamon is the safest and healthiest cinnamon there is. I add the recommended dose to my latte in the morning and makes it so spicy and delicious.
customer_reviews.author: Lily Munster

customer_reviews.title: Good and good FOR you.
customer_reviews.text: Golden tea or tumeric tea has been used in Ayurvedic medicine in India for thousands of years. I have fibromyalgia and IBS. I drink this EVERY evening. It calms my stomach, helps with digestion and decreases my inflammation (clearly not a doctor so take it for what it's worth😉) You can make it as spicy as you like but I add extra cinnamon and ginger to mine and sweeten it with Stevia brown sugar blend. Enjoy!!😊
customer_reviews.author: S.LEE

customer_reviews.title: A little goes a long way!
customer_reviews.text: I really didn't know what to expect but am pleasantly surprised! I use 1/4 teaspoon per cup of coffee. For me this is enough to give a deep, rich flavor - much more causes an almost bitter flavor and after taste. That, of course, means the bag will last longer - that's a great thing, as it is pretty pricey! Just a heads-up- because it is ground spices, it will NOT dissolve, so it really doesn't blend very well, and will leave a ring of spice residue around the inside of your cup. A minor inconvenience, considering the deep. rich flavor.
customer_reviews.author: KMJ

customer_reviews.title: Love the Ceylon cinnamon choice
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to try this for the purported benefits but was worried about whether or not I would like it. Thankfully, it tastes nice - very flavorful yet mild. I just warmed some milk, then added the powder and mixed with a stick blender. When it cooled a little, I also added some honey and a bit of coconut oil. This is not a sweet powder so the honey added a nice flavor. The reason I chose this over some other brands is that this uses Ceylon cinnamon instead of Cassia.
customer_reviews.author: TM Conway

customer_reviews.title: Realllllly good and peppery but sadly doesn’t blend well.
customer_reviews.text: It does not blend. but it taste great! i put 1/4 tsp in my tea and it taste so earthy and nice. but when i get to the bottom i get hit with this blast of peppery powder. I just keep stirring around or shaking whatever drink i made with it and i don’t mind. It has 120 servings.. which is amazing. i was looking at several others before this one that were only 25-90 servings.. each one was about $10-$20 more than this and it has way more. Definitely recommend trying
customer_reviews.author: Reese

customer_reviews.title: Great Stuff, Glad I Bought This
customer_reviews.text: I really like this product. I know some folks said it doesn't blend easily; I have a small hand whisk, so I just put a cup of almond milk in a microwaveable measuring cup, add half a teaspoon of this product, use the hand whisk, heat it in the microwave, pour it in a mug, add honey, and voila! I've read that turmeric chai has a lot of good health benefits, and so far I am very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: JustAGuy***

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Product has the right ingredients to maximize health benefits and bioavailability without any of the sugars, oils, or adaptogens that other competing products like to throw in. Taste is balanced and delicious. Price is perfect. Will always buy this in the future! I'd never had golden milk before and wanted to start drinking it for the health benefits. Such a lovely, warming, balanced drink! I make mine with a couple of tablespoons of coconut cream and hot water, no sweeteners. Spice mix blends effortlessly with waters and oils (no clumping). Couldn't be happier.
customer_reviews.author: J. S.

customer_reviews.title: A good antiinflamatory
customer_reviews.text: The product was mailed promptly. I like this brand because it only has four simple ingredients - turmeric, cinnamon, ginger, and black pepper. (Black pepper helps the body absorb the curcumin better.) The curcumin in turmeric is a good anti-inflamatory and antioxidant. I mix a teaspoon with almond milk, a little stevia, and a spoonful of almond butter - it's delicious. For a treat I mix it with almond butter and my sugar free coconut ice cream - yum.
customer_reviews.author: Terri Schmidt

customer_reviews.title: Beneficial healing and great taste.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift for my daughter who lives away from home for college, because she really enjoys matcha lattes. She cut coffee out of her diet as it was causing her anxiety. I thought this would be a healthy option for her. She really likes the flavor and said that the pain in her leg went away for the day after drinking it. I expect that is from the anti-inflammatory properties. So glad this is a beneficial product! Thank you A&I Nutreats!
customer_reviews.author: April B.

This speaks volumes...and her product is AMAZING!! I originally had purchased this brand and another highly recommended one to compare taste, etc and this one is so much better than the other one I bought--it's rich, creamy, dissolves and I'm just hoping to see health benefits after using it for some time. Thank you for standing behind your product!!!
customer_reviews.author: AGMommy2014

I’m sure this kind of thing is not easy to make in bulk, so good effort but taste and texture not quite for me is all.
customer_reviews.author: wboz

customer_reviews.title: This blend tastes great and the preparation very satisfying!

The ingredients not only help with my inflammation but preparing it that way fills me up and also helps with my blood sugar between meals. And it tastes so rich and satisfying! When heated it’s very much like a hygge drink but it can also be prepared in so many other ways including a cold shake. I look forward to trying other preparations and I will definitely be purchasing this again:)

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Blend Tea!!!
customer_reviews.text: Best blend I have tried so far!! I have tried multiple different blends of turmeric "ayurvedic" blend teas. I love the fact that this tea has Ceylon. All published health benefits from cinnamon is based on Ceylon (not the toxic liver damaging "Saigon" cassia cinnamon you are buying at the store). Turmeric tea is not a tea you drink because it taste like spring flowers. Turmeric/black pepper has been a healing and spiritual tea for centuries. Recent studies from major universities are no backing up the benefits of this combination. Stay away from internet garbage. Only read studies and results that are published at pubmed.gov !!!!

product_meta.title: Ayurvedic Organic Golden Milk blend; No added sugar or sweetener; 5oz (120 Servings); More than 50% Turmeric with Ceylon (true) Cinnamon; Anti-Inflammatory - Best for organic vegan latte recipe
feature_bullets: Turmeric and ginger, common Ayurvedic herbs, have both been used for centuries to support joint health and anti-inflammatory conditions. This powerful formula, enhanced by cinnamon and a dash of black pepper, creates a wonderful Ayurvedic blend that promotes digestion and immune support*.

Curcumin is the main active ingredient in turmeric. It has powerful anti-inflammatory effects and is a very strong antioxidant. Ginger is a potent antioxidant and anti-inflammatory agent; energizer and stimulator; supports the digestive system.

There are different types of cinnamon and they are not all created equally. We use only Ceylon Cinnamon (known as "True Cinnamon") compare to Cassia Cinnamon (known as Chinese Cinnamon). Ceylon is native to Sri Lanka and southern parts of India. Ceylon cinnamon is less common and is quite expensive compared to the more common Cassia cinnamon.
DelighTeas products are proudly made in the USA by A&I Nutreats.. All products are Caffeine free, Vegan, Organic, Gluten free, Non-GMO, No preservatives, No added sugar.
This pack will make approximately 120 cups of Golden Milk tea latte
